text:
Schermerhorn Street, south side, at, adjoining and east of Court Street, also shown is Court Street, east side, south of Schermerhorn Street. All buildings east of No. 62 which is the frame building west of St. Constantine's, Greek Orthodox Church, were still standing in 1929. The 4-story building at the extreme right, No. 111 Court Street, was also standing in that year. All other buildings between those mentioned above, were demolished by the Chanin Construction Company, and a 6-story office building was erected on the site. The new building is Nos. 101-107 Court Street.

1922.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

51-81 Schermerhorn Street, north side, between Court Street and Boerum Place. In center is the German Evangelist Church; next to it, the small building, is the Brooklyn Eye and ear Hospital, and next to it is the Brooklyn Lodge No. 22, B.P.O. Elks.

June 11, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

75-79 Schermerhorn Street, north side, between Court Street and Boerum place, showing rear of Brooklyn Eye and Ear Hospital.

June 11, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

64 Schermerhorn Street, south side, just east of Court Street, showing St. Constantine's Greek Orthodox Church.

April 7, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.
